gameDescription: In Operation Pollination, players graduate from pilots to keepers of nature controlling futuristic airships on a mission to save the rapidly declining bee populations worldwide. Carefully crafted decisions made while navigating through nature's hurdles play a pivotal role in the survival of the bees and the ecosystem.

blueTeam.name: Apis Aviators
blueTeam.description: Masters of botanic restoration and creation of bee-friendly habitats.

redTeam.name: Bombus Navigators
redTeam.description: Water conservation geniuses specializing in recovery missions.

turns.scenario: Post-Hurricane, the ravaged bee habitats must be recovered. Players must make a decision.

options.A: Plant native flowers in hurricane-affected areas to restore bee habitats.
options.B: Establish new bee colonies in safe zones to ensure their survival post-disaster.

AA.narrative: Both teams chose to restore the habitats. Efforts seen today will remain for generations. The face of the hurricane-devastated land changes gradually.

AB.narrative: Apis Aviators worked on habitat restoration while Bombus Navigators focused on securing a safe haven for the bees. The work done today will provide a safe future for the bees tomorrow.

BA.narrative: With Bombus Navigators restoring habitats and Apis Aviators creating secure zones for bees, the ecosystem is gradually healing from the disaster's effects.

BB.narrative: Both teams decided to secure safe zones for bees. Their collective efforts resulted in a safe haven for bees amidst the disaster.

turns.scenario: Wildfires have caused great damage. The teams must decide the best restoration approach.

options.A: Re-seed fire-ravaged areas with bee-friendly vegetation to encourage ecological recovery.
options.B: Construct artificial bee habitats in unaffected regions to support displaced populations.

AA.narrative: Both teams reseed the ravaged lands. The area slowly turns green over time. Bees return gradually, and the area buzzes with life again.

AB.narrative: The Apis Aviators focused on the reseeding while the Bombus Navigators built artificial habitats. The recovering vegetation and new homes marked a new beginning for many bees.

BA.narrative: Bombus Navigators committed to the reseeding, while Apis Aviators created new habitats. The efforts rebuilt parts of the lost world for the bees.

BB.narrative: Both teams prioritized building new habitats. The bees find a new home while their old one recovers naturally over time. A hiatus from the norm but a needed one.

turns.scenario: Sustainable expansion is possible now, but decisions must be carefully made.

options.A: Develop bee sanctuaries with advanced ecological technology for optimal habitat conditions.
options.B: Initiate educational campaigns to promote bee conservation and awareness.

AA.narrative: Both teams developed bee sanctuaries. With climate-controlled environments and abundant food, bees thrive at an unprecedented rate.

AB.narrative: While Apis Aviators opted for habitat development, Bombus Navigators focused on raising awareness. The nexus between advanced sanctuaries and awareness is building a safe home for bees.

BA.narrative: With Bombus Navigators developing sanctuaries and Apis Aviators conducting campaigns, more people are educated about the importance of bees as their population increases.

BB.narrative: Both teams conducted educational campaigns. Information and knowledge about bees pour over communities, creating many more advocates for bees.
